page.title: 13CATON SCHOOL OF EQUITATION
page.content: The present building was completed in 1953 and opened as a riding school in 1973, but there has been a riding school in that immediate area since much earlier.The first owner of the riding school was Mr Thornton.The present owner is Mr Wilson.The school has about 20 horses,most of which are cross-bred,but some of the pure breeds are Welsh Mountain,Arab,Shetland Pony. Out in the fields in Summer the horses eat grass.In the winter they eat pony nuts and hay,which they are given twice a day.The school does not train its own horses but buys them at an age of 9 or 10 years.A horse is not ready for training until it is about 4 years old, but even then it is too frisky for learner riders until about 8 years old.Each week,about 80 people attend the school,which has a jumping arena and cross-country course.
